claim: Flublok contains 3x the hemagglutinin (HA) antigen content of standard-dose flu vaccines, which has been linked to greater immunogenicity vs standard-dose flu vaccines.
explanation: Table listing influenza vaccine products with their presentations, age indications, HA (hemagglutinin) content per dose, administration route, and mercury content. For RIV4 (recombinant HA vaccine), Flublok Quadrivalent (Sanofi Pasteur) is shown as 0.5 mL prefilled syringe, ≥18 years, 45 µg/0.5 mL HA per virus, intramuscular. Evidence: Flublok Quadrivalent contains 45 µg/0.5 mL HA per virus compared with 15 µg/0.5 mL in standard-dose inactivated vaccines. The table shows Flublok has 3× the HA content of standard-dose vaccines but contains no data on immunogenicity outcomes, so it does not support the claim’s second part regarding greater immunogenicity. Note: Image is clear and shows antigen content but does not include any immunogenicity or clinical outcome data.
